channel.title: Mashable
channel.description: Mashable is a leading source for news, information & resources for the Connected Generation. Mashable reports on the importance of digital innovation and how it empowers and inspires people around the world. Mashable's 25 million monthly unique visitors and 10 million social media followers have become one of the most engaged online news communities. Founded in 2005, Mashable is headquartered in New York City with an office in San Francisco.
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader, subject to copyright and fair use.

item.title: Twitter will let you retweet yourself but everyone just wants an edit button
item.dc:creator: Karissa Bell
item.description:
Oh Twitter, will you ever be able to make us happy? 

In a move that will make narcissists everywhere rejoice, Twitter now allows you to retweet your own tweets, which is great and all, but everyone really just wants an edit button.

SEE ALSO: Twitter begins to relax its 140-character limit, users rejoice... and complain

Twitter announced the change Tuesday (by retweeting this tweet, announcing the retweet feature, from 2009.)

Previously, you could only retweet tweets sent by other accounts, which helped give rise to the tweetstorm. 

Naturally, Twitter reacted quickly, with complaining about the absence of that long-requested edit button — a point that also came up in the wake of Twitter's changes to its character limit last month. (And one that has come up with just about every significant product change Twitter has made over the last several years.)  Read more...

More about Apps And Software, Tech, and Apps Software

item.title: Beyoncé and fans donate more than $82,000 to Flint residents
item.dc:creator: Martha Tesema
item.description:
The world becomes a better place when the Beyhive and Beyoncé get in formation.

On June 13, Beyoncé's company, Parkwood Entertainment, donated $82,234 to the people of Flint, Michigan, to continue supporting recovery efforts from the recent water crisis.

SEE ALSO: Obama admits the truth we all knew already: 'Beyonce runs the world'

Donations came from fans who purchased tickets to the Formation World Tour. Concert attendees also had the option donate additional funds to help the cause. 

A check was made out to United Way of Genesee County, a privately funded nonprofit in communities across the country. According to a press release, the organization has distributed water filters, bottled water and provided emergency services to residents of Flint. Read more...

More about Donations, Flint Water Crisis, Beyonce, Watercooler, and Music

item.title: This dark 'Game of Thrones' fan theory predicts a bleak end for the Lannisters
item.dc:creator: Sam Haysom
item.description:
Warning: Contains spoilers from Game of Thrones Season 6, Episode 8, and A Dance with Dragons.

There have been a lot of Lannister-related Game of Thrones predictions lately, and the consensus seems to be the same: Things aren't looking good.

By now plenty of people think Cersei will attempt to burn down King's Landing — "Burn them all!" as Aerys II Targaryen would probably say — before Season 6 is out. There's also a theory that Jamie will be the one to ultimately kill her, thereby fulfilling the grim prophecy given to Cersei by Maggy the Frog when she was a little girl.

SEE ALSO: One 'Game of Thrones' character's absence might hold the key to a big death in Season 6 Read more...

More about Fan Theory, Theory, Uk, Cersei, and Game Of Thrones Season 6

item.title: Conan O'Brien on Orlando shooting: 'Weapons of war have no place in civilian life'
item.dc:creator: Yohana Desta
item.description:
Late night host Conan O'Brien opened his show with a message about the Orlando shooting, which he says is "still impossible to fathom." 

The comedian began by saying he's always made it a policy to "stick to my job and keep my opinions to myself," but he simply had to get personal on this issue. 

SEE ALSO: Samantha Bee delivers strong message on gun control on 'Full Frontal'

"I am a father of two," he said. "I like to believe I have a shred of common sense and I simply do not understand why anybody in this country is allowed to purchase and own a semi-automatic assault rifle."

He also agreed with the "rapidly growing sentiment in America that it's time to grow up and figure this out." He joins fellow late night hosts like Samantha Bee, who made a stirring call to "get semi-automatic assault rifles out of the hands of civilians."  Read more...

More about Conan O Brien, Television, Entertainment, and Tv

item.title: Latest Curiosity rover selfies show off Mars' red surface
item.dc:creator: Miriam Kramer
item.description:
A couple new selfies beamed back to Earth from NASA's Curiosity rover show the intrepid Mars explorer looking like a social media star on the red planet. 

The new selfies were taken on May 11 as Curiosity posed at a sample site near the bottom of Mount Sharp. 

SEE ALSO: Mars' ice age may have turned the red planet white 370,000 years ago

The self-portraits — one showing Curiosity facing toward the camera and one looking behind — actually show a drill site where the rover collected some Martian rock to test.

The photos also show Mount Sharp looming in the background.

Curiosity looking forward

Curiosity looking back

More about Curiosity Rover, Space Photos, Mars, Science, and Space

item.title: Freeform exploration in the new 'Zelda' game is an NES throwback
item.dc:creator: Adam Rosenberg
item.category: The Legend Of Zelda Breath Of The Wild
item.description:
Here's comparison that we never would have expected to draw: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild has more in common with The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim than it does past Zelda games.

Bethesda's open world RPG sets players loose in a freely explorable domain of snowy peaks and rocky steppes. A series of quests provide some direction in guiding you through the story, but there's nothing to step you from simply wandering off and forging your own path.

SEE ALSO: 'Star Wars' and Resident Evil wow in Sony's E3 highlights

Similarly, Breath of the Wild does away with the focused story that's been evident in recent Zelda games. It begins with a female voice beseeching you, over and over again, to "open your eyes." Read more...

More about Nintendo, The Legend Of Zelda Breath Of The Wild, The Legend Of Zelda, Entertainment, and Gaming

item.title: New 'Pete's Dragon' trailer is packed with perfectly nostalgic whimsy
item.dc:creator: Yohana Desta
item.description:
Khaleesi's not the only one with dragons this summer. 

Disney just dropped a new trailer for Pete's Dragon, the whimsical revamped tale of an orphan living in the forest with his sometimes-invisible dragon pal, Elliott. 

SEE ALSO: Disney's first 'Pete's Dragon' trailer is charmingly mysterious

The remake stars Bryce Dallas Howard, Robert Redford, Karl Urban, Oona Lawrence and Oakes Fegley as the titular Pete. The original film was released in 1977 and starred Mickey Rooney, Shelley Winters, Helen Reddy and more. 

Pete's Dragon hits theaters on Aug. 12. 

Have something to add to this story? Share it in the comments. Read more...

More about Disney, Movies, Entertainment, and Film

item.title: How to get macOS Sierra and iOS 10
item.dc:creator: Kellen Beck
item.description:
Apple announced big updates to its two major operating systems at WWDC, both coming to customers this fall: iOS 10 and macOS Sierra. If you don't want to wait till then, there's a way you can get in on the action earlier — you can opt in to the public betas for either update to test out some of the new features before they're ready to launch.

Beware, though: Beta versions of software are by definition incomplete and could have major bugs and issues that aren't resolved yet. Occasionally these bugs can even render your device unusable. You can't simply revert your device back to an earlier OS version, so make sure you get a backup of your device before going ahead with the beta. Read more...

More about Macos, Ios 10, Tech Utility, Wwdc, and Apple

item.title: 'Where does this stop?' Obama blasts proposed Muslim ban following Orlando attack
item.dc:creator: Colin Daileda
item.description:
"Where does this stop?"

President Barack Obama asked the question during a speech from Washington, D.C. on Thursday that was billed as an update on the fight against ISIS but turned into a speech about the future of the United States. 

SEE ALSO: Muslim girl goes to stay with Christian family in Indonesia to defeat ignorance

Obama forcefully critiqued the heated rhetoric targeting immigrants and Muslims in the wake of the killing of 49 people at a gay nightclub on Sunday by Omar Mateen, an American Muslim of Afghan descent. In particular, presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump has reiterated his calls for a ban on Muslim immigrants coming to the United States and suggested that the American Muslim community has been complicit in the violence.  Read more...

More about Election 2016, Presidential Election, Donald Trump, Hillary Clinton, and President Barack Obama

item.title: China's fake goods are so sharp that Alibaba is struggling to tell the difference
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.description:
Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. founder Jack Ma said Chinese-made counterfeit goods today have gotten better than the genuine article, complicating the effort to root out fakes on the country’s largest online shopping services.

Global brands have long relied on China and other low-cost manufacturing bases to beef up margins. But those same factories have gotten savvier over the years and are now using the Internet — including Alibaba’s platforms — to sell their own products straight to consumers, Ma told the company’s investor conference on Tuesday. Still, Alibaba is the best in the world at fighting the sale of counterfeits, he added. Read more...

More about Ecommerce, Alibaba, and Business

item.title: T-Rex tears through American Ninja Warrior course, despite extinction
item.dc:creator: Ryan Creamer
item.description:
"We are disproving evolution, the T-Rex is still alive!"

The crowd at American Ninja Warrior was treated to a prehistoric cinderella story, in the form of someone in a T-Rex costume impressively blazing through the show's obstacles.

The poor creature made an impressive showing, but it's only fitting that the small arms ultimately did the T-Rex in. 

Jimmy Fallon and Liam Hemsworth combine Slip 'N Slides and flip cup

Driver decides to show off his drifting skills in front of a cop

Disney's 'Moana' is here to thaw your 'Frozen' hearts

Try not to laugh at this angry dad being forced to catch eggs Read more...

More about Funny, Watercooler, T Rex, and American Ninja Warrior

item.title: Coat your sweet tooth in caffeine with Starbucks' 5 chilly new drinks
item.dc:creator: Brian Koerber
item.description:
Put down your iced coffee — there are some new chilly drinks in town.

Starbucks has unveiled five new limited-edition icy beverages, which will be available in participating stores across the United Sates and Canada starting Tuesday. Unfortunately, the new drinks will only be available after 3 p.m., as a part of the company's new Sunset Menu.

SEE ALSO: Starbucks releases two new iced beverages to keep you cool this summer

First up, Starbucks' new granitas will be available in three flavors, and feature finely-shaved ice that is then topped off with espresso, white tea or lemonade.

The Caramel Espresso Granita features lightly sweetened shaved ice with esporsso shots, cream and caramel drizzle, for those who still need a little afternoon caffeine boost. Read more...

More about Summer, Starbucks, Watercooler, and Conversations

item.title: New season of 'Curb Your Enthusiasm' officially coming to HBO
item.dc:creator: Sandra Gonzalez
item.description:
The wait is almost finally over. 

HBO has announced that a new season of Curb Your Enthusiasm is officially in the works. 

SEE ALSO: 'Game of Thrones' fans are furious that HBO changed a significant Daenerys Targaryen detail

"We’re thrilled that Larry [David] has decided to do a new season of CURB and can’t wait to see what he has planned,” said Casey Bloys, president of programming at the network.

HBO has not given a target premiere date for Season 9. 

According to a release from HBO, when asked why he decided to come back, David responded: “In the immortal words of Julius Caesar, ‘I left, I did nothing, I returned.'" Read more...

More about Curb Your Enthusiasm, Hbo, Television, Entertainment, and Tv

item.title: 'Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild' is a vast, open-world game
item.dc:creator: Chelsea Stark
item.category: Legend Of Zelda Breath Of The Wild
item.description:
Link has learned a lot of new skills.

In the longest preview for the next Legend of Zelda game — now subtitled Breath of the Wild — we see the series hero Link climbing, chopping down trees and even cooking. Nintendo gave an extensive preview of Breath of the Wild at E3 Tuesday morning.

Nintendo announced this Zelda iteration at E3 2014, and it was slated to come to Wii U at the end of 2015. Since then, the game has been delayed twice, and is now coming to the Wii U and the yet-to-be-revealed NX platform, which is launching on March, 2017.

Breath of the Wild is the biggest Zelda game ever, according to Nintendo of America President and COO Reggie Fils-Aimé, who introduced the game during a streaming presentation.  Read more...

More about E3, Nintendo, Legend Of Zelda Breath Of The Wild, Entertainment, and Gaming

item.title: OnePlus 3 is practically the perfect Android smartphone
item.dc:creator: Raymond Wong
item.description:
It's always way more fun to root for the underdogs. The little guys with fewer resources. They're the guys who fight the hardest to keep the lights on because it's truly shoot for the moon or go bust.

OnePlus has been fighting an uphill battle against Apple, Samsung, LG, HTC, Xiaomi — pretty much every smartphone maker — as the company's grown since 2013.

SEE ALSO: OnePlus 2: Is the most hyped Android phone really a 'flagship killer'?

Learning lessons is a necessary part of growing. For OnePlus, it would appear they've learned a lot of lessons in the last year.

The company's new flagship OnePlus 3 is mighty impressive on paper and even more incredible in your hand. This is Nexus-, Galaxy- and iPhone-level excellence, but with a price that destroys all of them. Read more...

More about Mashable Choice, Reviews, Smartphones, Android, and Oneplus 3

item.title: 'Westeros Recruitment' is your go-to site for 'Game of Thrones' jobs
item.dc:creator: Sam Haysom
item.description:
LONDON — If you're a hard-working Westerosi who happens to be down on your luck, all you need to do is head over to the hottest recruitment site in the Seven Kingdoms.

Westeros Recruitment is a parody career website packed full of Game of Thrones themed job vacancies. The whole thing is a marketing stunt made by Time Recruitment, but as far as marketing stunts go, it's one of the better ones.

SEE ALSO: Heirbnb is your new go-to site for affordable vacations in Westeros

Each job post is based on stuff that happens in the actual show.

Here's a breakdown of the skills required for the role of Bran's PA: Read more...

More about Parody, Funny, Uk, Game Of Thrones Season 6, and Game Of Thrones

item.title: Crowdsourcing app allows everyone to help rescue refugees from the sea
item.dc:creator: Gianluca Mezzofiore
item.description:
MALTA — Thanks to a newly launched app, people all over the world can give a crucial contribution to charities and NGOs involved in the rescue of refugees in the Mediterranean Sea. 

I Sea is the first crowdsourcing project of this kind and allows everyone with a smartphone to scan satellite images of a particular plot of ocean to find migrant boats in difficulty.

SEE ALSO: Student creates minimalist wash bags for refugees

The app, available on the Apple Store (the Android version is being tested), is a collaboration between the Migrant Offshore Aid Station (MOAS) and Singapore-based Grey for Good. Read more...

More about Refugees, Refugee Crisis, Search And Rescue, Isea, and Crowdsourcing

item.title: Electric Daisy Carnival will stream on Facebook Live
item.dc:creator: Emily Blake
item.description:
Electric Daisy Carnival, the nation's largest dance music festival, is embracing Facebook Live. 

EDC will use Facebook to transport fans to its 20th anniversary celebration in Las Vegas this Friday. The EDM festival — which moved from Los Angeles to Las Vegas in 2011 — will also be available to stream on on YouTube, Twitch.TV, Insomniac.com and LNTV.com.

SEE ALSO: Snapchat Rolls Out Group-Sharing Feature for Concerts, Live Events

From 11:30 p.m. to 8:30 a.m. ET this Friday, Saturday and Sunday, the live stream will show sets from the massive event's eight stages. It will also capture behind-the-scenes moments, interviews with artists and wedding ceremonies from the festival's chapels.

 Read more...

More about Electric Daisy, Electricdaisy, Edc, Dance, and Facebook Live

item.title: Disney's 'Moana' is here to thaw your 'Frozen' hearts
item.dc:creator: Sophie Hirsh
item.description:
Despite taking place in tropical Hawaii, Moana just may be the next Frozen.

Disney released the first teaser trailer for their upcoming animated film Moana, starring Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson as demigod Maui and Auli’i Cravalho as Moana, a teenager who appears to have water powers.

Moana's music is written by Hamilton's Lin-Manuel Miranda as well as Opetaia Foa'i and Mark Mancina, and it will be released this Thanksgiving. 

Hopefully Moana will fill the void not getting Hamilton tickets has left in all of us.

Jimmy Kimmel and Ice Cube bring us 'Kidz Bop: Hip Hop' edition Read more...

More about Entertainment, Film, Viral Video, Disney, and Lin Manuel Miranda
item.content:encoded:
Despite taking place in tropical Hawaii, Moana just may be the next Frozen.

Disney released the first teaser trailer for their upcoming animated film Moana, starring Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson as demigod Maui and Auli’i Cravalho as Moana, a teenager who appears to have water powers.

Moana's music is written by Hamilton's Lin-Manuel Miranda as well as Opetaia Foa'i and Mark Mancina, and it will be released this Thanksgiving. 

Hopefully Moana will fill the void not getting Hamilton tickets has left in all of us.

Driver decides to show off his drifting skills in front of a cop

Try not to laugh at this angry dad being forced to catch eggs

7 years later, 'The Last Guardian' finally has a release date

Jimmy Kimmel and Ice Cube bring us 'Kidz Bop: Hip Hop' edition Read more...

item.title: Apollo 7: Simple, compact wireless earbuds in a gimmick-filled gadget world
item.dc:creator: Ray White
item.description:
In this week's episode of Plugged In, Mashable Tech Correspondent Ray Wong gives you the low down on the Apollo 7 earbuds. They don't come with any fancy features on other wireless earbuds; Bragi's Dash, for example, has a fitness trainer-like assistant in your ear. The Apollo 7 earbuds are all about listening to music, which is exactly what you need in today’s gimmick-filled gadget world.

Full review: http://on.mash.to/1VXaNJF Read more...

More about Reviews, Wireless, Earbuds, Earphones, and Tech

item.title: These are the companies with the fewest women in leadership roles
item.dc:creator: Casey Butler
item.description:
Major companies like Coty, Kia and Nintendo have been singled out for their lack of gender diversity in a new report detailing the boardrooms of some of the world's most high-profile corporations.

LedBetter, a research group backed by the International Women's Media Foundation, released its first report on Tuesday, showing that many companies have few or no women in top leadership positions. 

H&M Group, Gap Inc., and Best Buy are among the companies with the greatest gender diversity in leadership roles.

Overall, the study found a drastic shortage of women at the top of companies: Only 6% of the companies in the LedBetter database have a woman as CEO.  Read more...

More about Corporate Business, Business, and Diversity

item.title: Miley Cyrus shatters the glass ceiling in cut-for-time 'SNL' sketch
item.dc:creator: Sandra Gonzalez
item.description:
Don't mess with the Workplace Warriors. 

In a newly released, cut-for-time sketch from the most recent season of Saturday Night Live, Miley Cyrus and other fierce ladies take on cigar-smoking misogynists in an ad for a fake WE show called Women Workplace Warriors. 

SEE ALSO: Colin Jost on how that bloody good 'Dead Poets Society' sketch on 'SNL' came to be

While seeing Cyrus, who hosted an episode back in Oct. 2015, don a late '80s women's power suit is fun, one of the best moments from the sketch comes about three minutes in, when a stunt doesn't exactly go as planned and almost makes Kate McKinnon — ever the pro — crack up.  Read more...

More about Saturday Night Live, Snl, Television, Entertainment, and Tv

item.title: Five-year-olds go on a date that puts adult dating to shame
item.dc:creator: Sophie Hirsh
item.description:
PizzaExpress is more romantic than it sounds.

Proving that 5-year-olds are not too young to woo one another properly, Freddie Gibson and Dee Dee Jones went on a cuter first date than possibly anything that's ever come out of Tinder.

A spokesperson for the location of the very charming first date gave Mashable all the details.

SEE ALSO: Little girls give adult women makeovers and solid dating advice

"Freddie had been talking about asking Dee Dee on a ‘date’ for a while, so as they’re both huge PizzaExpress [A restaurant chain in the UK] fans it seemed like the obvious (and fun!) place for them to go," Nina Gibson, Freddie's mom, told to PizzaExpress. Read more...

More about Watercooler, Cute Kids, Love, Dating, and Pizza

item.title: It's the end of the fossil fuel era as we know it
item.dc:creator: Andrew Freedman
item.description:
Contrary to what the fossil fuel industry may want you to believe, the transformation of the world's energy supply to clean energy sources is well underway, according to a new report from Bloomberg New Energy Finance (BNEF). 

The "New Energy Outlook" report, released Monday, finds that at least $11.4 trillion will be invested in new power-generating capacity over the next 25 years, and 60 percent of that will fund wind and solar power. 

SEE ALSO: U.S. and India agree to cut the most important global warming pollutant you've never heard of

According to the report, we'll reach a tipping point in 2027, when new wind and solar power actually become cheaper than running existing coal and gas generators in much of the world. This will cause an acceleration in the deployment of clean energy technologies. Read more...

More about Science, Fossil Fuels, Paris Climate Agreement, Paris Climate Summit, and Wind Power

item.title: AI fools humans with fake sound effects
item.dc:creator: Lance Ulanoff
item.description:
The auditory Turing test has been defeated.

When MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Lab researchers showed videos of a drumstick hitting and brushing through various objects, subjects were fooled into believing that the sounds they heard actually came from the objects and materials on screen.

They did not.

Instead, a computer programmed to analyze the video and apply the correct sounds from its own library of samples chose the audio clips for all the videos. And the subjects were none the wiser.

SEE ALSO: Bill Gates: AI is the holy grail

The team’s work is described in a new paper released Monday and being presented next week at the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition conference in Las Vegas. Read more...

More about Audio, Turing Test, Artificial Intelligence, Science, and Tech

item.title: 11-foot, dead alligator found clogging storm drain in Florida
item.dc:creator: Andrea Romano
item.description:
An 11-foot alligator was found in a storm drain in Fort Meyers, Florida, after the Lee County Public Works office received complaints about a foul odor in the area.

The alligator had unfortunately died while it was stuck in the drain, and the subsequent blockage had caused the odor neighbors complained about.

SEE ALSO: The tiny Florida town that has more mermaids than humans

Public Works employee Roger Desjarlais posted a photo of the animal as workers were pulling it out of the drain. Eleven feet is an average size for a typical American alligator.

"About twice a year we get calls for gators," said public information officer Betsy Clayton to News Press. Most alligators found in the drains are significantly smaller. Read more...

More about Conversations, Pics, Funny, Wtf, and Animals

item.title: Driver decides to show off his drifting skills in front of a cop
item.dc:creator: Brian Koerber
item.description:
Dash cam footage from a driver in Australia shows a little bit of instant karma delivered to a reckless driver.

As the driver with a camera was waiting for the light to change, a car comes barreling around a corner, drifts, overcorrects and ends up facing the wrong way on a street. 

Much to the amusement of the dash cam owner, a marked police vehicle was also sitting at the light, and promptly ended the drifter's fun. 

Try not to laugh at this angry dad being forced to catch eggs

7 years later, 'The Last Guardian' finally has a release date

Jimmy Kimmel and Ice Cube bring us 'Kidz Bop: Hip Hop' edition

Jimmy Fallon and Liam Hemsworth combine Slip 'N Slides and flip cup Read more...

item.title: YouTube community expresses sadness, understanding over new VidCon safety rules
item.dc:creator: Saba Hamedy
item.description:
LOS ANGELES — When YouTube musician Christina Grimmie was shot and killed Friday night in Orlando, the community lovingly referred to as Team Internet came together to mourn one of their own.

Less than two days later, another 50 people lost their lives in a mass shooting — also in Orlando — at a gay nightclub. The fatal incident also shook Team Internet to its core, especially because YouTube has become known as a safe space for members of the LGBTQ community. 

The back-to-back tragedies sparked a discussion about something that has been a big part of the community: Are meet-and-greets, the quintessential experience between digital influencers and their fans, now too unsafe? Read more...

More about Security, Christina Grimmie, Orlando Mass Shooting, Vidcon, and Team Internet

item.title: Try not to laugh at this angry dad being forced to catch eggs
item.dc:creator: Ryan Creamer
item.description:
Unexpected eggs are the worst kind of eggs.

YouTube channel Angrydad follows in the footsteps of Jamie Keith tossing eggs at his unprepared mom, though this dad handles things a bit, well, angrier.

Mad as he may be, he's still nabbing these eggs left and right. We're not sure why he always wears the same clothes, though.
